item.title: 股市狂飙的四月之后，投资者希望特朗普能给出明确答案
item.description: 四月让股市投资者尝尽了各种滋味：当唐纳德-特朗普总统挑起全球贸易战时，股价暴跌让人落泪；当他暂停一些最严厉的关税措施时，股价反弹让人如释重负；而当经济动荡的迹象越来越多时，股价却仍在上涨，这又让人感到困惑。【原文：April gave stock market investors a little bit of everything: Tears as share prices plunged when President Donald Trump started a global trade war, relief as they bounced back when he paused some of his harshest tariffs, and confusion as they rose despite increasing signs of economic turmoil.】

item.title: Ares 为邓白氏 55 亿美元融资寻求合作伙伴
item.description: 据知情人士透露，战神管理公司（Ares Management Corp）已开始与其他贷款方接触，希望他们能参与一笔 55 亿美元的融资，以支持 Clearlake Capital Group 收购 Dun & Bradstreet Holdings Inc.【原文：Ares Management Corp. has begun reaching out to other lenders to participate in a $5.5 billion financing to support Clearlake Capital Group’s buyout of Dun & Bradstreet Holdings Inc. in what would be one of the largest private credit deals ever arranged, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 2025 年初美国经济为何萎缩？
item.description: 衡量一国经济健康状况的唯一最佳方法是什么？对于大多数专家来说，国内生产总值（一个国家生产的所有商品和服务的季度统计）是评估和比较经济活动的黄金标准，这一点几乎没有争议。【原文：What’s the single best way to measure the health of a country’s economy? For most experts, there is little debate that gross domestic product, a quarterly tally of all the goods and services a country produces, is the gold standard for assessing and comparing economic activity.】

item.title: 非政府组织称西班牙电信 Movistar 公司面临委内瑞拉重大数据泄露事件
item.description: 据当地一家非营利组织报道，西班牙 Telefonica SA 在委内瑞拉的子公司 Movistar 发生大规模数据泄露事件，数百万客户的个人数据被曝光，凸显了该国数字通信的脆弱性。【原文：A local non-profit reported a massive data leak from Spain’s Telefonica SA subsidiary in Venezuela, Movistar, which exposed the personal data of millions of clients, highlighting the vulnerability of the country’s digital communications.】

item.title: 雪花网络老板提供去年黑客攻击客户的教训
item.description: 2025 年 4 月 17 日星期四，美国纽约，Snowflake Inc.美国股市交易稳定，扭转了当天早些时候的涨势，原因是华尔街交易员权衡了最新财报结果以及唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税对美国企业的影响。【原文：Snowflake Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. US stocks traded steady, reversing gains from earlier in the day, as Wall Street traders weighed the latest earnings results and the impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Corporate America.】

item.title: 中国保险经纪公司元宝纽约首秀大涨 93
item.description: 元宝公司的美国存托股票短暂飙升，比首次公开发行价高出 93%，这家中国保险分销商不畏市场波动和贸易紧张局势，在纽约首次亮相。【原文：Yuanbao Inc.’s American depositary shares briefly soared as much as 93% above their initial public offering price, as the Chinese insurance distributor defied market volatility and trade tensions to make its New York debut.】

item.title: 美联储外部审查呼吁围绕资产购买设立警戒线
item.description: 根据对美联储长期战略的外部审查，美联储应为如何部署大规模资产购买制定一个指导框架。【原文：The Federal Reserve should develop a guiding framework for how it deploys large-scale asset buying, according to an external review of the central bank’s longer-run strategy.】

item.title: 债务危机加剧，墨西哥石油公司连续第四次亏损
item.description: 墨西哥石油公司第一季度继续亏损，这是这家陷入困境的国有石油公司在努力提高产量和摆脱巨额债务的过程中遭遇的又一次挫折。【原文：Petroleos Mexicanos’ losses continued in the first quarter, another setback for the embattled state oil company as it struggles to boost production and dig itself out from massive debts.】

item.title: 津巴布韦交易员未来将面临一度繁荣的股市带来的损失
item.description: 长期以来，津巴布韦股票交易商习惯于从货币混乱中获利，货币混乱刺激了对股票的需求，但由于流动性紧缩，他们正在计算自己的损失。【原文：Zimbabwe stock traders, long used to profiting from currency chaos that has spurred demand for equities, are counting their losses as a liquidity crunch curtails business.】

item.title: 关税之后，布鲁克菲尔德考虑对美国制造业进行投资
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德基础设施合伙公司（Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP）正在寻求对美国制造业进行投资，因为在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统提出关税计划后，许多公司都计划建立新工厂。【原文：Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP is looking to invest in US manufacturing operations as companies plan to build new plants following President Donald Trump’s tariff plans.】

item.title: 美国杠杆贷款将出现罕见的连续月度亏损
item.description: 美国杠杆贷款有望出现自 2022 年以来的首次月度连跌，这对于一直受益于投资者对浮动利率债务需求的市场来说是罕见的下滑。【原文：US leveraged loans are on track to post their first monthly losing streak since 2022, a rare slide for a market that had been benefiting from investor demand for floating-rate debt.】

item.title: 皮查伊告诉法庭，谷歌希望今年达成 Gemini-Phone 人工智能交易
item.description: Alphabet Inc.首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊（Sundar Pichai）周三在法庭诉讼中表示，他希望公司的人工智能服务 "双子座"（Gemini）今年能作为内置选项添加到 iPhone 中。【原文：Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said in court proceedings Wednesday that he hopes that Gemini, his company’s AI service, will be added as a built-in option for iPhones this year.】

item.title: 特朗普称他迎来了总统任期的最佳开局。经济另有隐情
item.description:
特朗普第二任期伊始，美国国内生产总值出现下滑，而就业和物价保持稳定。几乎所有方面的前景都在恶化。【原文：

Trump’s second term begins with a decline in US GDP, while jobs and prices hold steady. On almost all fronts, the outlook is getting worse.

】

item.title: 谷歌皮查伊称美国的补救措施是 "事实上 "的搜索分拆
item.description: Alphabet Inc.首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊（Sundar Pichai）告诉一名认定谷歌非法垄断在线搜索的法官，司法部提出的与竞争对手共享搜索数据的建议将 "事实上 "剥离该公司的搜索引擎。【原文：Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai told a judge who found that Google illegally monopolizes online search that a Justice Department proposal to share search data with rivals would be a “de facto” divestiture of the company’s search engine.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官称特朗普应修改人工智能芯片出口规则
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）表示，他希望特朗普政府能修改美国向世界其他国家出口人工智能技术的法规，以便美国企业未来能更好地抓住机遇。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said he’d like the Trump administration to change regulations for exporting artificial intelligence technology from the US to the rest of the world so American businesses can better capitalize on the opportunities in the future.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉 Polar 公司在哥伦比亚收购两家食品厂进行扩张
item.description: 委内瑞拉食品巨头 Empresas Polar 表示，它收购了巴兰基亚的两家生产厂，作为其进一步向哥伦比亚扩张计划的一部分。【原文：Venezuelan food giant Empresas Polar said it acquired two production plants in Barranquilla as part of its plan to further expand into Colombia.】

item.title: 美国消费者支出跃升，而关键通胀指标放缓
item.description: 美国消费者支出在 3 月份大幅增长，而衡量通货膨胀的一个关键指标却有所放缓，这在关税预计将广泛推高物价之前是一个值得欢迎的缓和迹象。【原文：US consumer spending jumped in March while a key measure of inflation decelerated, a welcome reprieve before tariffs are expected to broadly drive up prices.】

item.title: 澳大利亚房价在周六投票前创下历史新高
item.description: 澳大利亚房价在周六大选前连续第三个月攀升，创下历史新高，同时抵御了美国引发的全球贸易动荡给经济带来的日益严重的不确定性。【原文：Australian home prices climbed for a third straight month to a record high ahead of an election on Saturday, while defying rising uncertainty over the economic fallout from US-driven global trade turmoil.】

item.title: Meta、应用程序制造商在华盛顿发起游说，与苹果和谷歌抗衡
item.description: 应用程序制造商Meta Platforms Inc.、Spotify Technology SA和Match Group Inc.正准备与全球两大智能手机平台展开一场高风险的政治斗争，争论谁应该承担验证用户年龄的责任。【原文：App makers Meta Platforms Inc., Spotify Technology SA and Match Group Inc. are girding for a high-stakes political battle with the world’s two dominant smartphone platforms over who should take responsibility for verifying users’ ages.】

item.title: 美国成屋待售量创 2023 年以来最大增幅
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率的短暂下降和房屋供应量的增加，春季购房者纷纷出手，3 月份美国旧房待售量创下一年多来的最大增幅。【原文：Pending sales of previously owned US homes rose in March by the most in more than a year as a brief dip in mortgage rates and a rising supply of houses brought out spring shoppers.】

item.title: 坦桑尼亚称价值 420 亿美元的液化天然气交易因使用当地内容而推迟
item.description: 坦桑尼亚副总理多托-比特科（Doto Biteko）表示，政府希望在 10 月份之前与国际石油公司就拖延已久的价值 420 亿美元的液化天然气设施条款达成一致。【原文：Tanzania’s Deputy Prime Minister Doto Biteko said the government wants to agree the terms of a long-delayed $42 billion liquefied natural gas facility with international oil companies by October.】

item.title: 经济数据疲软削弱信心，股市开盘暴跌
item.description: 周三开盘时，美国股市下跌，将结束六天连涨的势头，因为在一系列疲软数据公布后，对经济放缓和通胀持续走高的担忧笼罩着交易商。【原文：US stocks dropped at the open Wednesday, set to snap a six-day winning streak, as worries about an economic slowdown and sticky inflation gripped traders following a raft of weak data.】

item.title: 中国主权基金在贸易战风险下削减美国私人资产
item.description: 据知情人士透露，由于世界两大经济体之间不断升级的贸易战威胁到中国的投资，中国投资有限责任公司（China Investment Corp.【原文：China Investment Corp., the nation’s $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund, is cutting exposure in US private markets to curb risks as an escalating trade war between the world’s two largest economies threatens its investments, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 赞比亚矿业部将于 6 月底公布当地含量规则
item.description: 赞比亚矿业和矿产开发部表示，赞比亚将在本季度末宣布新的法规，规定矿业公司必须优先考虑当地供应商的商品和服务水平。【原文：Zambia will by the end of this quarter announce new regulations governing the level of goods and services mining companies must give preference to local suppliers, the Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development said.】

item.title: 海湾地区债券激增，沙特 PIF、BSF、DP World 进军债券市场
item.description: 本周三，中东借款人涌入一级市场，进行了三笔美元债券交易，这是今年以来地区信贷和伊斯兰债务最繁忙的日子之一，因为他们希望利用更好的市场条件。【原文：Middle Eastern borrowers are flooding the primary market with a trio of dollar bond deals on Wednesday, marking one of the busiest days for regional credit and Islamic debt this year as they look to take advantage of better market conditions.】

item.title: Grindr 转向 Anthropic，亚马逊为人工智能僚机功能提供动力
item.description: Grindr Inc.表示，该公司正在使用亚马逊公司和Anthropic公司的人工智能工具为其 "Wingman "产品开发功能，而不是依赖初创公司Ex-human Inc.的聊天机器人。【原文：Grindr Inc. said it’s using artificial intelligence tools from Amazon.com Inc. and Anthropic to develop features for its “Wingman” product, rather than relying on chatbots from startup Ex-human Inc.】

item.title: 印度预测五月酷热难耐，停电风险上升
item.description: 在 6 月份季风季节开始之前，印度正准备迎接酷热，这可能会给电网带来压力，并对居民的健康构成严重威胁。【原文：India is bracing for scorching heat until the start of the monsoon season in June, potentially straining power grids and posing a severe health risk to residents.】

item.title: 随着 OMO 购买激增，印度央行开始解除美元空头头寸簿
item.description: 印度央行削减了美元远期合约中的空头头寸，因为它可能会让部分合约到期。【原文：India’s central bank cut down on short positions in its dollar forward book as it likely let some of the contracts mature.】

item.title: TWG 参股穆巴达拉资本，承诺出资 25 亿美元
item.description: 由古根海姆合伙人公司（Guggenheim Partners）创始人马克-沃尔特（Mark Walter）和金融家托马斯-图尔（Thomas Tull —）领导的投资公司 TWG Global 正在入股穆巴达拉投资公司（Mubadala Investment Co.【原文：TWG Global - the investment firm led by Guggenheim Partners founder Mark Walter and financier Thomas Tull — is taking a stake in Mubadala Investment Co.’s asset management subsidiary as part of a multi-billion dollar collaboration.】

item.title: 特朗普挑起紧张局势，欧盟将放弃对美国技术的依赖
item.description: 欧盟将承认自己无法摆脱美国科技巨头的控制，此举可能会缓和与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易争端。【原文：The European Union is set to concede it can’t break free from the power of US technology giants, in a move that could de-escalate a trade row with President Donald Trump.】
